content:
Posted: July 13, 2012
												Zombie Panic : Source is the sequel to the popular Zombie Panic game. As stated, it's a mod, so you'll need to download a Source game such as Half Life 2 or Team Fortress 2. Overally, the game is very interesting and in some degree, a 'realistic' representation of a zombie apocalypse. It puts you in the role of a Survivor or a Zombie, which you can choose at the start of the match, don't worry too much if you want to play as a zombie though, almost everyone will go survivor, meaning that someone will randomly be selected as the infected. If you volunteer to be Infected, you'll be the special zombie carrier, that has slightly more health compared to the default infected. He also has the ability to infect other survivors, who, if they don't find medicine, will become infected themselves. While becoming infected, the survivor will be unable to speak, and will hear heartbeats. Even if the survivor cures himself, he'll be greeted with a flash of colors that will last for a while, to be precise, he's blinded. If he's not protected by his teammates, he'll probably get killed. There are many maps, and most of them feature doing a certain objective or standing ground untill all the infected respawn counters are depleted. The goal of the infected is to kill survivors and turn them, nothing interesting.Overally, the 'Game' is very good and get's a 9/10 from me. Just keep in mind that the community is dying right now due to the release of the sequel to this 'Game' called Contagion. But it's still worth playing this Mod though.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2013
												Zombie Panic! Source is a co-op oriented Survivor vs Zombie multi-player survival horror mod.In the mod, players can generally participate in timed matches against the opposite team, or the humans try to solve objective-based missions. One thing that really separates Zombie Panic! from Left 4 Dead is that if you die, you will become a zombie. To prevent yourself from going the way of the undead, you will have to arm yourself with shotguns, rifles, explosives and more. In addition to a lot of last man (or zombie) type matches, as previously mentioned, there are also objective-based scenarios. In these modes, humans will often have to find resources like wood boards or gas canisters, turn cranks and knobs, or do a combination of both. Zombie Panic! Source is an overall good-looking mod with some minor clipping issues.So if you are looking for another interesting take on the oncoming zombie apocalypse, Zombie Panic! Source is not a bad choice.Sounds 7/10Graphics 7/10Gameplay 8/10Atmosphere 8/10If you liked my review, please feel free to follow me and/or my curator group:http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ov3RT4K3R/myworkshopfiles/?section=guideshttp://steamcommunity.com/groups/orcollective#curationAlso feel free to check out my YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC83DYCmrWfl9ttrhX54jmWA

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2016
												On the first day I played on cabin_outbreak and church maps, where you have to defend for 10 minutes. I was addicted to it for the day, as it had interesting things like building barricades, placing blanks of wood over walls. And you could use Source engine for the great good (and the great evil for zombies) to barricade the stairs and doors with actual prop using dem physics.Then I realized that it sucked, just like Zombie Horde for Doom Skulltag. Zombies just walk around, tanking everything, while humans camp on high ground and shoot everything or run around in open ground and hunt zombies, who are just too slow for that. Tons of weapons and ammo, hilarity ensues. You win as zombies only because some humans aren't good enough or get too bored.Didn't take long time to realize that these maps are like cp_orange in TF2. Something awful that attracts lots of people for weird reasons.Thankfully, there was server running stock and custom objective-based maps as well, so I was addicted for another day. All yay humans not being able to just camp and having to move and share ammunition.Then I still realized that it didn't fall too far from Zombie Horde either. Zombies can ambush, but they still have to tank and dance around while being shot. They still can win if there is too many.  While humans fight cheapness with cheapness by having revolver than one-shots them all into head. As usual with PvP zombie games with no AI zombies, it starts with humans easily doing everything and most likely win unless they make some mistake and it all steamrolls down the hill, usually.And don't know, maybe I am too spoiled by Zombie Horde taking over Doom Skulltag, but this one felt uninspired and kinda samey.

												This isn't left for dead, or killing floor. Or any of AI controlled zombie shoot em up games. Players take the role as zombies, and other players take the role of survivors. It takes the gameplay of counter strike, think of counter terrorists and terrorists. Each map has randomly selected weapons for you to find, a large variety of weapons to be exact. You must have a game that runs a source engine though. (CS:S, Tf2, HL2, as so on.)

number of helpful: 1 of 7 people (14%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 7, 2015
												It takes a lot to make a good zombie gameHaving player controlled zombies isn't the way forwardLeft 4 Dead gave you special infected; zombies that could pack a punch if the player behind it had some skill. But in this, the undead are slow with the stupidest sprint mechanic imaginable. So joining a game late and being forced onto the zombie team just isn't fun.Playing the survivors is just pitiful.Melee weapons seem to have no punch behind them, and the same can be said for firearms. I get absolutely no feedback on whether the shot hit or missed because the undead don't flinch almost at all. The ammo drop system is probably the most complex and easily forgettable I have encountered in my gaming life.Maps, especially survival maps, are pain-stakingly repeatetive. Survivors always hold up in the same space. I feel utterly dumbstruck when I'm in a garage with one easily defended entrance and two garage doors for quick escapes, ammunition and weapons littering the floor and anyone else who spawned with me storms off to the meta position as if miffed by how the spawn system dared not spawn them inside the ♥♥♥♥ing top floor of that house (Yes, cabin, you overused ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, I'm looking at you).Now, I'm not going to complain too much about the graphics, considering their age and how I sort of like these kinds of graphics. What I am going to complain about is how bored I got while playing it. As a survivor, I'm waiting in the meta spot (Because standing anywhere else is essentially suicide) waiting for a zombie to come clear into view without the possibilty of missing with the pistol everyone gets, before it is immediatley shot by some other guy who has three firearms strapped to his back. Once the undead storm us, we all die and those who run tire eventually and are caught by the infected. As a zombie I spend half the time knocking down the door before A: The objective changes and their's a brand new door I can keep bashing my head against until it breaks out of pity or B: I open it and am turned into a collander. I run out of sprint easily as I try to get to the survivors before they move on, and can't catch up to them because they used that ♥♥♥♥ing panic move.I understand that this game is an 8 year-old community mod and making zomies human controlled may have been a good way of not writing the seven-thousand lines of programming for a single step of an AI controlled one, and it gives dead players something to do other than twiddling their thumbs, but it's very hard to do without causing a complete imbalance.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												So, I jumped back into ZPS after roughly two-and-a-half years of owning the game without playing it. Along with one of my friends, I joined a custom server running a custom map, but no other mods. Within five minutes, two other people had joined, making a total of four on the server - not ideal, since we were planning on inviting one of our other friends for a three player match, but we had no ways of creating a private server at the time, and "what could possibly go wrong?".One of these people was friendly, complimenting us after each kill and/or match, whereas the other was a racist ten-year-old that I presume was Russian (he could speak English, but not very well). He barricaded himself inside a house using indestructable objects, wedged himself INSIDE said objects to prevent us from entering, and proceeded to taunt us, calling us many things that I frankly would not want to hear when playing a game for a night of fun. We only managed to win due to the infectious properties of the Alpha Zombie (whom I was playing at the time) combined with a lucky hit, at which point he proceeded to shout/talk loudly over the mic (I had the in-game mic off already, but my friend had to turn it off in order to continue playing without being distracted).I know that this doesn't sum up the whole community, but this experience put me off the game for at least two-and-a-half more years. Thanks, kid, I appreciate it.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2011
												Meh. Game is uber buggy.Pros: It's pretty interesting to play a game where you can take either the human or zombie side. I haven't found an alternative to this game yet, but it can be fun if you find the right server to play on. The game is pretty intense if you can get it working.Cons: The game lacks support. The developers did their best with what they had. Without anyone really playing it, there is hardly any servers to play on. This is due to the many problems with bugs. If you have over 200 ping, you can forget even playing this game. The maps the game has to offer suck for the most part.There is fun to be found in the game. But seeing how someone is going to do a better job somewhere else. You are better off playing other Zombie Survival games. Which they are starting to pop up now (DayZ)

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												This game is meh at the most. It was a massive disapointment. I saw that Contagion was about £30, but this was free and was by the same developers. So, when I got it, I realised my friends had it as well so I could play with them. Basically the game is a human/zombie deathmatch. And if you don't like that, it gets worse. If you're new to the game, you probably get put in the zombie's team. And the game is full of complete sweats, which are probably on the human's team. And when you're on the human's team, you're freaking unstoppable. But if you do get killed as a human, you would probably turn over to the zombie's side, so you would be killed and killed and killed. This game is really bad and I advise you not to get it, even though it's free.

Posted: November 20, 2010
												Panic in the streets!  It's an outbreak of horror movie proportions!  You and your group of up to 30 survivors must stop the zombie outbreak before it starts.  If the zombie gets someone, they become a zombie!  Two becomes four, four becomes eight, and so on and so forth!!  Action, intensity, tension, and just plain multiplayer fun make this a great addition to your Steam library.REQUIRES ANY SOURCE ENGINE GAME (Half-Life 2, Counter-Strike: Source, etc.)

Posted: December 19, 2013
												I used to play this every weekend when I was younger in like 2009/10 or something and was restricted to using my computer of weekends because my older brothers hogged it like crazy. It was one of my favourite games to play alongside Team Fortress 2 and Insurgency: Modern Infantry and if people still played it, as would I. Despite owning Left 4 Dead 2, I opted to play this game instead.In this game you can play as a Zombie and as a Survivor, finding upgraded guns and ammo along the way. The best way to play it was to gather friends or try to find a server that actually worked as a team, otherwise they wouldn't share the ammo and would often pick up ammo they didn't need, thus killing off any hope other survivors had at surviving.You're supposed to barricade the doors and as time passes, go through each level to reach either the helicopter, boat or van or whatever and survive until it leaves which was very difficult if your team members were all over the place.It was so much fun when there were a lot of players in the servers as you had many zombies, and the first Zombie was a zombie that was able to infect players on hit (they would then appear green or something to other zombies and would usually be left so that they could turn on their players), and the other zombies had to kill players in order to turn them.I'd still recommend it now, if you could get enough players into a server you'd probably have a lot of fun, but since that likely isn't the case anymore, go play L4D2.

Posted: November 9, 2015
												"A unique gamestyle for the zombie theme. The survivors must prepare themselves for an onslaught from the infected: Stocking up on firearms, ammunition, and anything to bludgeon the infected with. Barricading the doors and windows with various objects and furniture, or completing multiple tasks to progress and escape; requiring teamwork, and strategic coordination to survive. The infected must attack, kill, and turn the survivors into one of their own, one by one, increasing the number of their shambling ranks. The game may be old, but still provides fast and intense, close quarters combat that will entertain any gamer."

Anyway, still one of the best zombie defense games I have played.

												This is a really fun game! The graphics are better looking than the screenshots suggests, and there are way to many foreign kids screaming on the mic to noone in particular, but theres always the mute. The ammo is generally scarce, so playing with a few friends and sharing stuff is better than having all the weapons hogged by strangers. Posted: December 19, 2013
												I used to play this every weekend when I was younger in like 2009/10 or something and was restricted to using my computer of weekends because my older brothers hogged it like crazy. It was one of my favourite games to play alongside Team Fortress 2 and Insurgency: Modern Infantry and if people still played it, as would I. Despite owning Left 4 Dead 2, I opted to play this game instead.In this game you can play as a Zombie and as a Survivor, finding upgraded guns and ammo along the way. The best way to play it was to gather friends or try to find a server that actually worked as a team, otherwise they wouldn't share the ammo and would often pick up ammo they didn't need, thus killing off any hope other survivors had at surviving.You're supposed to barricade the doors and as time passes, go through each level to reach either the helicopter, boat or van or whatever and survive until it leaves which was very difficult if your team members were all over the place.It was so much fun when there were a lot of players in the servers as you had many zombies, and the first Zombie was a zombie that was able to infect players on hit (they would then appear green or something to other zombies and would usually be left so that they could turn on their players), and the other zombies had to kill players in order to turn them.I'd still recommend it now, if you could get enough players into a server you'd probably have a lot of fun, but since that likely isn't the case anymore, go play L4D2.

Posted: October 12, 2011
												The game features four modes of gameplay, Zombie Panic! Survival mode, Zombie Panic! Objective mode, Zombie Panic! Hardcore mode, and ZPA mode. In survival mode, the zombies start with a number of lives based on the amount of players which are slowly depleted as zombies are killed and subsequently come back. In this mode, the round can only be won if one side completely destroys the other or after 15 minutes and survivors are still left standing. A Zombie life is gained if a human is killed and the human that dies, respawns on the zombie team. Objective mode introduces a set of objectives the survivors must complete. The zombie team has an infinite number of lives in objective mode, so zombies can always join the action again if they are killed. Hardcore mode dramatically increases the strength of the undead horde. Survivors must survive for five minutes rather than 15, but this shorter time to beat is compensated by more zombies at the start of the round, all of these initial zombies

												Very fun. Ammo and guns create added weight for more realism, and zombies are strong and slow, but have a short lunge meter they can fill over time. The overall balance of the two makes this game fun to play from either perspective.You can even hit H to holster your weapon and shove sofas in front of doors, and use barricade hammers to make certain hallways, corridors, or windows temporarily inaccessible with short or long 2x4 boards (until zombies start attacking your fortifications!)Overall a great mod, but for clarification the only reason it's considered a "mod" is the same reason Pirates, Vikings, Knights II calls itself such. The development team just doesn't see it as a "full" game yet, with some things to be worked over time.Zombie mod just doesn't compare.

												This game is quite amazing. While old, it brings to life the idea of a Zombie-killing FPS. During it's prime when many people played it, this game was amazing. Overall, I believe this game is well worth a try despite it's dwindling player base, in order to stop the player base from evaportating all together people must be willing to play it despite this fact. Posted: September 30, 2013
												This mod is really one of the best mods out there. You`ve got to get this mod its so fun. It adds a little horror feel when your at the end or something like that or you just don`t want to die, like me. When I start at the beggining I always get as much ammo for my pistol as possible. Then I check my melee weapon and if I don`t like it, I drop it (with G) and pick up a better one if I see one (with E). The good thing about this game is that you don`t have to be alone in the darkness, but you can turn on your flashlight (with F) and guide your teamates if they dont know how to turn it one, or just get a little light. Keep in mind that if you leave your flashlight on in lighted areas for too long, and then go back to a dark area, your flashlight won`t work that much.Also if you have to much ammo and want to give some to someone, select the ammo you want to give him/her (with V) and then give it to him/her (with T).I give the game a BIG 8.5/10. Its a very good mod but the only downside is that the zombies have too much health. Oh and I forgot to tell you that you can choose what team you want to play as. If either the survivors (to join you have to go through a door that might tell you "Join survivors" or "survivors") or zombies (just stay put and you`ll be joined to zombies). Oh and also there are different guns sometimes rare to find. And zombies also have a flashlight-like feature called zombie vision. Posted: February 1, 2013
												This Half-Life 2 mod pits survivors against the deadly "Whitey" and his undead minions in multiple game modes and maps. The overall goal is for the survivors to complete a set of objectives or survive for a set amount of time while the zombies attempt to kill every living player. Cooperation is a must for the survivors. Resources are limited and should be shared and players should stick together, otherwise completing their goals are near impossible. A typical server gives Whitey a 10-30% chance of infecting a human player on hit. Infected players will eventually turn into a zombie so they can either choose to keep quiet once their symptoms set in and get a surprise attack in on them or tell everyone so they can be shot and killed before they turn. If you own a game that utilizes the Source engine you can download this game and play it for free. The controls take some getting used to, but it's very fun!

Posted: January 21, 2014
												Perhaps one of the best zombie games of all time with different modes providing something for everybody. Unlike other zombie games, all zombies are player controlled, this removes the issues surrounding dumb AI and really creates the air that you are being hunted (but can create issues surround rage quitters/afkers). At the start of each match, a proportion of the players are assigned the starting zombies (assuming that too few choose to be), after this, any player joning will automatically be assigned as a zombie and any survivor who dies will become a zombie. This can lead to a snowball effect where, from a single zombie, a horde can decend upon the last few survivors as they make their last stand. Zombies generally respawn when they die unless the mode type is where they have a finite number of lives and the objective is to kill them all. Survivors start each match with a pistol and a melee weapon, throughout the maps lay various weapons such as shotguns and automatic rifles (and the ammo) that can greatly help in taking out the zombies. A weight system keeps track of how much you are carrying and adjusts your running speed accordingly, you also have a stamina bar that lowers as you run and subsequently will also slow you down. These two mechanics are there to try and reduce gun/ammo hording, if you are slow then you are zombie bait. Staying together, covering each other and ammo sharing is a must though there is no mechanic that forces you to stay with the group.Zombies have a simple melee attack, in each team there is a single special inffected that has slightly greater health, deals more damage and infects survivors (they then change into zombies after a while). Ambushes are the name of the game usually for zombies until the late game where a horde of zombies can simple rush the survivors.The relative difficulty of playing either survivor or zombie varies greatly with each map and the mode of play, while you will inevitable gain more kills as a survivor (even though you have a single life per match), an experienced player can still rack up the kills as a zombie with each one giving you the satisfaction in knowing that your horde is growing.Personally, my favourite mode is the objective mode where survivors are given a series of tasks to complete to attain victory, a good map to try would be Biotec. The survivor modes task you with surviving untill either a timer runs out or the zombies run out of respawn lives (which one of these two depends on the map), two maps that are popular are Cabin and Church. There is also a competitive mode for team warfare but this is played little. This mod has been out a very long time, as such the graphics tend to be reasonble poor but this game isn't about staring over a well rendered valley. It is about getting out there and killing as much as you can, whether that is getting those headshots or feasting on your opponents brains, it is up to you.

												Very fun. Ammo and guns create added weight for more realism, and zombies are strong and slow, but have a short lunge meter they can fill over time. The overall balance of the two makes this game fun to play from either perspective.You can even hit H to holster your weapon and shove sofas in front of doors, and use barricade hammers to make certain hallways, corridors, or windows temporarily inaccessible with short or long 2x4 boards (until zombies start attacking your fortifications!)Overall a great mod, but for clarification the only reason it's considered a "mod" is the same reason Pirates, Vikings, Knights II calls itself such. The development team just doesn't see it as a "full" game yet, with some things to be worked over time.Zombie mod just doesn't compare.

Posted: November 26, 2011
												This game is quite amazing. While old, it brings to life the idea of a Zombie-killing FPS. During it's prime when many people played it, this game was amazing. While still amazing, it's lost much due to lack of players. However, this does not deter it's superb gameplay, unique feel and style, and uniqely defined concept of player zombies. This game's difficulty varies dependent on which server you play on and with whom you play with, but no matter what it still remains difficult. Overall, I believe this game is well worth a try despite it's dwindling player base, in order to stop the player base from evaportating all together people must be willing to play it despite this fact. I reccomend this game to anyone who has been a fan of HL2 style FPS games and also fans of classic zombie FPS games. On a scale of 10, I give ZPS a 8.5.

Posted: November 9, 2015
												"A unique gamestyle for the zombie theme. The survivors must prepare themselves for an onslaught from the infected: Stocking up on firearms, ammunition, and anything to bludgeon the infected with. Barricading the doors and windows with various objects and furniture, or completing multiple tasks to progress and escape; requiring teamwork, and strategic coordination to survive. The infected must attack, kill, and turn the survivors into one of their own, one by one, increasing the number of their shambling ranks. The game may be old, but still provides fast and intense, close quarters combat that will entertain any gamer."

Posted: August 11, 2014
												After spending time in the Zombie community, i have developed a new outlook on their kind. I have discovered that zombies aren't just rabid animals that need a bullet in the head, they are indeed intelligent beings capable of working in a group to accomplish a task. They do, however, lack any job related skills thus leaving them left to scavange for food. They cannot vocalize how they feel or what they want in a language that we know. It took me quite some time to learn their language but i did and I found it to be beautiful. I will no longer simply put a bullet in the heads of zombies in other games or blow their brains out all over my friends. I realize they sometimes just need a hug. I will, instead, give them a limb to chew on as they do get hungry sometimes. So remember, next time you see a zombie, just give them a hug and if they bite you they are just hungry.To donate human and animal limbs to the Zombie community please call 1-800-ZOMBIES today. They will thank you.

Posted: November 24, 2010
												Zombie Panic! Source: A great balanced game of survival and wits. The Survivors are slown down with the amount of ammo and guns they are holding and have flashlighs with them at all times. The Zombies are stronger, slower (But they do have a lunge bar that they can cause by causing damage to enemy players) and can see Survivors a long distance away, this makes the gameplay even and fair. The price is free and the only thing you need to get it is Half Life 2 to run it. I would say a "Yes" to downloading this game if you like team-work and zombies, If not then this is a fun game to play for the many user-made game types and levels.

Posted: January 26, 2013
												Considering it has no campaing and has only mutiplayer, this is still easily one of the greatest zombie games ever made, not to mention being an excellent mod utilizing the Half-Life engine. Co-operate with other survivers, to stay alive or achieve abjectives. All zombies are other players spawned randomly, and when you die you respawn as a zombie to kill your former allies. This is an excellent mechanic,  your enemies think, plan, and are always  trying to hunt you down and eat you. This allows   for intense struggles to stay alive, as more and more zombies are spawned.               ------- With a very dark and desperate feel to the game, death lurks around every corner. You will find yourself looking over your shoulder constantly trying to see them before they get to you.  ------I have over 800+ hours of play time so far, and it is still fun and challenging.----- 9/10 RATING ---- EXCELLENT GAME!

												Zombie-Panic Source will always hold a special place in my heart even as it enters the twilight years of its existance.  The gameplay is straight-forward and fun for survivors and zombies alike and it is intensely fun to play with friends.  While I definitely recommend this game for others, it is important to note that there aren't as many servers out there as when I first started playing in 2009.

Posted: April 10, 2011
												Mow down everything in your path in an attempt to make it to the end of a map, while either barricading yourself into whatever structure you can and keeping an eye on your teammate that you swear got hit by a whitey a while ago; or simply dropping everything for a bit of extra speed. The gameplay variety on offer in this game surprises me every time I come back to it. While it may not be seeing a whole lot of support from its developers nowadays, and its servers are shutting down and losing players every day... I still have an inordinate amount of respect for this game. It really did stick out in the enormous crowd of Source mods back when it was made. The cheesy voice acting, the odd mechanics, the constant trolling and toxicity from its community... it all came together to create something strangely special. Unless you really familiarize yourself with this mod it will likely just fall into your mental trash heap of generic zombie titles. However, if you do take the time to play around with it, I think you'll have a whole lot more fun than you'll likely have expected to get from it. 8/10 - a flawed but oddly unique mod that differed itself from every other zombie game in a way that's really enjoyable to some. I'll be sad the day it completely dies out.

Posted: December 19, 2013
												I used to play this every weekend when I was younger in like 2009/10 or something and was restricted to using my computer of weekends because my older brothers hogged it like crazy. It was one of my favourite games to play alongside Team Fortress 2 and Insurgency: Modern Infantry and if people still played it, as would I. Despite owning Left 4 Dead 2, I opted to play this game instead.In this game you can play as a Zombie and as a Survivor, finding upgraded guns and ammo along the way. The best way to play it was to gather friends or try to find a server that actually worked as a team, otherwise they wouldn't share the ammo and would often pick up ammo they didn't need, thus killing off any hope other survivors had at surviving.You're supposed to barricade the doors and as time passes, go through each level to reach either the helicopter, boat or van or whatever and survive until it leaves which was very difficult if your team members were all over the place.It was so much fun when there were a lot of players in the servers as you had many zombies, and the first Zombie was a zombie that was able to infect players on hit (they would then appear green or something to other zombies and would usually be left so that they could turn on their players), and the other zombies had to kill players in order to turn them.I'd still recommend it now, if you could get enough players into a server you'd probably have a lot of fun, but since that likely isn't the case anymore, go play L4D2.

Posted: January 24, 2013
												This is a really fun game! The graphics are better looking than the screenshots suggests, and there are way to many foreign kids screaming on the mic to noone in particular, but theres always the mute. Sometimes you can get on a server and have a very pleasant conversation with some nice people. The ammo is generally scarce, so playing with a few friends and sharing stuff is better than having all the weapons hogged by strangers. Theres nothing more fun than holing up in a dark room, waiting for the timer to wear down and rescue arriving, having pushed all the cabinets against the door. One good thing is that many props and walls are destructible, so zombies can almost always get it without defense.The game is free with HL2, so theres no point in not trying it out!17/20

Posted: April 21, 2012
												Strangely, Zombie Panic has an element to it that peculiar in that even though it is not designed to be a horror game, it has a feeling of intense fear. One reason that is largely responsible for this is how tough zombies are. A simple bullet or two like left 4 dead does not get the job done, and head shots are the key. Also, another key component is ammo. Most servers have you starting out with a pistol, and only one spare magazine. This sounds reasonable, but you quickly discover that it does not have the power that you will need in a combat situation. The game makes you quickly realize that, as a survivor, this is not team deathmatch, this is survivial, and you are the target. Running and staying hidden is inevitably usually your best option.

												Hands down the best multiplayer zombie game out there! as far as i can tell it has the best barricading system of any game, being able to brace doors with your body and being able to push almost any object in front of windows and doors. you also can use wooden planks which come up as hammers in your inventory, which are used to block/hinder the zombies path. its a shame that not many people play it anymore, but you can find 3-4 servers up with a decent population. Posted: March 10, 2015
												A decent zombie multiplayer game.  The game is good, and features some of the toughest zombies in any video game.  The zombies are also controlled by real players, rather than AI.  This is an interesting feature to the game that makes it more challenging and difficult.  The game lacks in map design and variation, as there are only a few maps.  Overall, the game is worth downloading.  75/100.

Posted: October 26, 2013
												Very fun F2P game. it's entirely PVP or PVZ (as the zombies are player controlled) there are Objective based maps and deathmatch maps. Too bad there ain't many people on it anymore like back in it's hey day :*(
